      • onHostPause

        public void onHostPause()

      • onHostResume

        public void onHostResume()

      • getNodeValue

        public java.lang.Object getNodeValue(int nodeID)
        Null-safe way of getting node's value. If node is not present we return 0. This also matches iOS behavior when the app won't just crash.

      • findNodeById

        public <T extends Node> T findNodeById(int id,
                                       java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Null-safe way of getting node reference. This method always returns non-null instance. If the node is not present we try to return a "no-op" node that allows for "set" calls and always returns 0 as a value.
